name: Bacon & Blue Cheeseburger Naan Pizza
recipe:
Spread each naan with 3 Tbsp dressing; top each with 1/2 cup mozzarella and half the beef, onions, and bacon. Sprinkle each with 1 Tbsp mozzarella. Cook using desired method.
  
Grill 
Preheat grill to MED. Place naan on nonstick foil sheet; transfer to grill. Grill, covered, 5-10 min, until crust begins to brown.

Oven
Preheat oven to 450 degrees with rack in center. Transfer pizzas directly to oven rack. Bake, 7-10 min, until crust begins to brown. 

Oven with Pizza Stone
Set stone in cold oven; heat 15 min at 450 degrees. Transfer pizzas carefully to preheated stone (use oven mitts; stone is extremely hot). Bake, 5-7 min, until crust begins to brown.

nutrition.information: Each serving (1/2 pizza) contains 630 calories, 35 g carbohydrate, (1 g fiber), 30 g protein, 41 g fat,  (17 g saturated fat), 110 mg cholesterol, and 1080 mg sodium.

ingredients.name: Food You Feel Good About Traditional Naan Flat Bread
Wegmans Organic Chunky Blue Cheese Dressing
Wegmans Shredded Part-Skim Mozzarella (Dairy Dept), divided
Wegmans Fully Cooked Bacon, cut in 1-inch pieces

name: Classic Baked Lobster Tails
recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Remove meat allowing smaller end (fan) of tail to remain attached. Place meat on top of shell "piggy-back" style; place on baking sheet.
      
  2. Brush each tail with 1 Tbsp basting oil. Season with salt.
     
  3. Bake 14-15 min, until internal temp reaches 145 degrees (check by inserting thermometer halfway into thickest part of meat).

nutrition.information: Each serving (1 lobster tail) contains 200 calories, 0 g carbohydrate, (0 g fiber), 16 g protein, 15 g fat,  (2 g saturated fat), 125 mg cholesterol, and 420 mg sodium.

name: Gluten-Free Braised Beef Brisket
recipe:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Season brisket with salt and pepper. Heat oil in braising pan on stovetop on MED-HIGH until oil faintly smokes; add brisket, fat-side down. Turn over when brisket changes color one-quarter of way up and seared side has browned. Sear all sides of brisket until uniformly browned. Remove from pan; transfer to clean platter.
     
  2. Add celery, carrots, onions, turnips, and parsnips to pan. Cook, stirring, 4-5 min, until vegetables begin to brown. Add tomato paste; cook, stirring, 1-2 min. Add stock, wine, and thyme. Transfer mixture to roasting pan; add beef. Bring to a simmer. 
      
  3. Cover; braise on center rack of oven about 2 hours. Carefully remove cover and cook 30 min, or until fork-tender.
     
  4. Remove pan from oven; transfer brisket and vegetables to serving platter. Keep warm; let rest 15 min.
     
  5. Whisk pan-searing flour into pan liquids; heat to simmering. Simmer 2-3 minutes until thickened.
     
  6. Carve brisket diagonally across grain; serve with vegetables and sauce.

nutrition.information: Each serving (about 5 oz meat, 3/4 cup veg, 1/2 cup sauce) contains 590 calories, 19 g carbohydrate, (4 g fiber), 41 g protein, 37 g fat,  (14 g saturated fat), 135 mg cholesterol, and 480 mg sodium.
nutrition.servingSize: about 5 oz meat, 3/4 cup veg, 1/2 cup sauce

ingredients.name: Food You Feel Good About Vegetable Oil
Food You Feel Good About Baby Cut Carrots
Food You Feel Good About Chopped Onions
turnip, peeled, quartered, cut in 1/2-inch slices
parsnip, peeled, halved lengthwise, cut in 1/2-inch slices
Food You Feel Good About Beef Culinary Stock
Food You Feel Good About Thyme leaves
